section.title: Lenovo Fibre Channel and iSCSI drivers
section.para: The LenovoFCDriver and LenovoISCSIDriver Cinder drivers allow Lenovo arrays to be used for block storage in OpenStack deployments.

simplesect.title: System requirements
simplesect.para: To use the Lenovo drivers, the following are required:

listitem.para: Lenovo S3200 or S2200 array with:
Network connectivity between the OpenStack host and the array management interfaces
HTTPS or HTTP must be enabled on the array
Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes.
Create, list, and delete volume snapshots.
Create a volume from a snapshot.
Copy an image to a volume.
Copy a volume to an image.
Migrate a volume with back-end assistance.

step.para: Verify that the array can be managed via an HTTPS connection. HTTP can also be used if lenovo_api_protocol=http is placed into the appropriate sections of the cinder.conf file.
Confirm that virtual pools A and B are present on the array.

Create two entries for storage backends in the cinder.conf file, one for each storage pool to be used with OpenStack. You will need to enter: the appropriate driver name; IP address or hostname of the management interface; the username and password of an array user account with 'manage' privileges; and the iSCSI IP addresses if using the iSCSI transport protocol. This information will be repeated in each entry.

In the examples below, the first two parameter values are different for each entry; the volume_backend_name value should match the name of the backend entry, and the lenovo_backend_name value must be the name of the storage pool on the array.

example.title: iSCSI example backend entries
example.programlisting:
[lenovo-a] volume_backend_name = lenovo-a lenovo_backend_name = A volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.lenovo.lenovo_iscsi.LenovoISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage lenovo_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5
[lenovo-b] volume_backend_name = lenovo-b lenovo_backend_name = B volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.lenovo.lenovo_iscsi.LenovoISCSIDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage lenovo_iscsi_ips = 10.2.3.4,10.2.3.5

example.title: Fibre Channel example backend entries
example.programlisting:
[lenovo-a] volume_backend_name = lenovo-a lenovo_backend_name = A volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.lenovo.lenovo_fc.LenovoFCDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage
[lenovo-b] volume_backend_name = lenovo-b lenovo_backend_name = B volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.lenovo.lenovo_fc.LenovoFCDriver san_ip = 10.1.2.3 san_login = manage san_password = !manage

step.para: If HTTPS is not enabled in the array, include lenovo_api_protocol = http in each entry.

If HTTPS is enabled, certificate verification can be enabled with the option lenovo_verify_certificate=True. The lenovo_verify_certificate_path can be used to pass a path to a CA_BUNDLE file to specify CAs other than the default list.

Modify the [DEFAULT] section of the cinder.conf file to reference the two backend entries, editing the default_volume_type and
enabled_backends parameters:
After modifying cinder.conf, restart the cinder-volume service.
